title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Yanes M (2025). opentranslatr: Translate R using opensource frontends common translations engines. R package version 0.3, http://.marioyanes.es/opentranslatr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {opentranslatr: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines},   author = {Mario Yanes},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3},   url = {http://me.marioyanes.es/opentranslatr/}, }

what: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
title: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
text: R package allows translate text directly R: dataframes strings, lets use common translations engines like Google Translate using frontend, benefit terms privacy. now, supported ones: SimplyTranslate. supports Google Translate, Reverso inCIBA. Lingva. supports Google Translate. gtranslate. Lightweight frontend Google Translate. can selfhost Docker image. Mozhi. Fork SimplyTranslate, now supports features translation engines, Deepl, LibreTranslate DuckDuckGo.

previous_headings: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
title: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
text: Translate texts, strings R objects without leaving R using frontends Google Translate Reverso. Automatically detect languages. Get list available languages.

previous_headings: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
title: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
text: package yet available CRAN, must install GitHub using remotes package.
code: if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("myanesp/opentranslatr") # And then load into your current session library(opentranslatr)

previous_headings: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
title: Translate in R using opensource frontends for common translations engines
code: lingva(from = "es", to = "fr", str = "hola, ¿cómo estamos?") [1] "Bonjour, comment allez-vous?"  simplytranslate(from = "en", to = "de", str = "welcome!") [1] "Willkommen!"  simplytranslate(from = "en", to = "fr", str = "welcome!", engine = "reverso") # select engine [1] "bienvenue!"  mozhi(from = "en", to = "de", str = "beach", instance = "http://localhost:3000") [1] "Strand"  gtranslate(from = "en", to = "es", str = "table") [1] "mesa"  get_languages() # Get available languagues for the frontend you choose  get_mozhi_engines() # Get available languages for the Mozhi instance you choose

Translate strings using SimplyTranslate — simplytranslate
text: SimplyTranslate support three translation engines: Google Translate, inCIBA Reverso. can specify one want use session-wide every time execute function. function also helps selection SimplyTranslate instance want use.

title: Translate strings using SimplyTranslate — simplytranslate
code: simplytranslate(from, to, str, instance = NULL, engine = NULL)

title: Translate strings using SimplyTranslate — simplytranslate
text: Source language. Specify code following ISO 639 standard Specify code following ISO 639 standard str Text translate instance SimplyTranslate URL want use engine translation engine want use: "google", "reverso" "inciba"

title: Translate strings using SimplyTranslate — simplytranslate
